concept.title: Web UI users and roles
concept.shortdesc: There are three types of Web UI user roles: system administrators, messaging administrators, and Web UI users.

conbody.p: The system administrator role has access to all of the view and configuration tasks provided in the Web UI. The system administrator can access using the web-based user interface. The following table shows the actions which system administrators, messaging administrators, and Web UI users are authorized to perform.

table.title: Different Web UI users have the authority to undertake different tasks. Example mappings are shown in this table. The first column contains examples of actions that can be performed. The second column contains examples of actions a system administrator is authorized to undertake. The third column contains examples of actions a messaging administrator is authorized to undertake. The fourth column contains examples of actions a Web UI user can perform..

row.entry: Configuring secure communications (SSL/TLS profiles, certificates, and keys)
Configuring an endpoint, selecting an interface to use, viewing and selecting configured SSL/TLS profiles, and selecting a port
Configuring a topic, subscription or queue policy (Example: configure a topic policy to authorize a client/user to publish or subscribe to a topic).
